{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>In dem Brandm√ºllerischen Buchladen wird ein <BIBL><TITLE>Project von Hiorini klugen und verst√§ndigen Hau√ü-Patter, wie auch avelichem Land-Leben</TITLE>, welches durch Subscriptionen in <VOLUME>2. Folianten</VOLUME>  <PRIZE>6. fl.</PRIZE> gedrucket wird</BIBL>. Ferner ist allda ne� fertig worden: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Lutheri</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Bibel</TITLE> mit Figuren in <FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT></BIBL>; Item, des Herrn Abbts <BIBL><AUTHOR>Fleury</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Kirchen-Historien</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> aus dem frantzcsischen ubersetzt</BIBL>; Item, <BIBL><TITLE>die gantze Pflicht des Menschen</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> aus dem Englischen ubersetzt</BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":4,"explanation":"1) Closed the first <TITLE> element correctly. In the source, the </TITLE> tag appeared immediately after <AUTHOR>Hiorini</AUTHOR>, leaving the rest of the title text outside the title element and then creating a stray </TITLE> later. I removed the early </TITLE> and moved it to the end of the full title phrase so that the entire phrase ‘Project von Hiorini klugen und verständigen Hauü-Patter, wie auch avelichem Land-Leben’ is enclosed in one <TITLE>…</TITLE>.
2) Wrapped “des Herrn Abbts Fleury … aus dem frantzösischen ubersetzt” into a proper <BIBL> block. In the original, <AUTHOR>Fleury</AUTHOR>, <TITLE>Kirchen-Historien</TITLE>, and <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> were not enclosed in a <BIBL>, which is inconsistent with the rest of the record. I added <BIBL> before <AUTHOR>Fleury</AUTHOR> and </BIBL> after “aus dem frantzösischen ubersetzt”.
3) Ensured well-formed nesting so that each <BIBL> element contains its bibliographic subelements and text in a valid XML hierarchy, and that all tags are properly closed.
4) Left the mojibake-like characters (√º, √§, √ü, , etc.) as literal text content because they appear to be encoding artefacts from the source rather than structural markup errors. They do not break XML well-formedness, so no normalization was applied there."}

parsed.fixed_xml: <ITEM>In dem Brandm√ºllerischen Buchladen wird ein <BIBL><TITLE>Project von Hiorini klugen und verst√§ndigen Hau√ü-Patter, wie auch avelichem Land-Leben</TITLE>, welches durch Subscriptionen in <VOLUME>2. Folianten</VOLUME>  <PRIZE>6. fl.</PRIZE> gedrucket wird</BIBL>. Ferner ist allda ne� fertig worden: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Lutheri</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Bibel</TITLE> mit Figuren in <FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT></BIBL>; Item, des Herrn Abbts <BIBL><AUTHOR>Fleury</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Kirchen-Historien</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> aus dem frantzcsischen ubersetzt</BIBL>; Item, <BIBL><TITLE>die gantze Pflicht des Menschen</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> aus dem Englischen ubersetzt</BIBL></ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Closed the first <TITLE> element correctly. In the source, the </TITLE> tag appeared immediately after <AUTHOR>Hiorini</AUTHOR>, leaving the rest of the title text outside the title element and then creating a stray </TITLE> later. I removed the early </TITLE> and moved it to the end of the full title phrase so that the entire phrase ‘Project von Hiorini klugen und verständigen Hauü-Patter, wie auch avelichem Land-Leben’ is enclosed in one <TITLE>…</TITLE>.
2) Wrapped “des Herrn Abbts Fleury … aus dem frantzösischen ubersetzt” into a proper <BIBL> block. In the original, <AUTHOR>Fleury</AUTHOR>, <TITLE>Kirchen-Historien</TITLE>, and <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> were not enclosed in a <BIBL>, which is inconsistent with the rest of the record. I added <BIBL> before <AUTHOR>Fleury</AUTHOR> and </BIBL> after “aus dem frantzösischen ubersetzt”.
3) Ensured well-formed nesting so that each <BIBL> element contains its bibliographic subelements and text in a valid XML hierarchy, and that all tags are properly closed.
4) Left the mojibake-like characters (√º, √§, √ü, , etc.) as literal text content because they appear to be encoding artefacts from the source rather than structural markup errors. They do not break XML well-formedness, so no normalization was applied there.
